title: Pineapple Granita
ingredients: 1 large pineapple, peeled, cored, and puréed
instructions: In a saucepan combine the water and sugar and bring the water to a boil over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.  Simmer the syrup for 5 minutes and let it cool

In a blender purée, by batches, the ripe pineapple and place the purée in a large mixing bowl.  When all the pineapple has been processed stir in the syrup and lemon juice.  Pour this mixture into two freezer trays and freeze it until it is firm but not frozen hard.  Transfer the mixture to a bowl and beat it smooth.  Again transfer the mixture back to the freezer trays and to the freezer.  Freeze the mixture for 3 hours more, or until it is firm.
Take from the freezer and let the freezer trays stand at room temperature for 5 minutes, or until it is just soft enough to scoop.
Remarks:  You may wish to use food coloring to enhance the granita’s color.
Source:  Gastronomie Sans Argent, Granitas, Gourmet Magazine, September 1978.
